DGACM.relevance_comment: Establishes the Department’s overall role to play a proactive and facilitating role in enhancing effectiveness and efficiency of intergovernmental activities — a broad mandate that underpins the entire PPB (overall orientation and programme of work across subprogrammes 1–4).

Mandates the Department to provide technical secretariat services and substantive support to the General Assembly and its main committees — directly implemented in the PPB under Subprogramme 1 (General Assembly and Economic and Social Council affairs).

Mandates the Department to provide technical secretariat services and substantive support to the Economic and Social Council and its bodies — reflected in PPB tasks and targets under Subprogramme 1 and the Department’s servicing of ECOSOC.
Mandates provision of secretariat support to the Trusteeship Council — corresponds to the Department’s servicing responsibilities described in the PPB (Subprogramme 1).

Mandates the Department to provide technical secretariat services to conferences and ad hoc/extraordinary meetings under UN auspices — implemented across PPB subprogrammes for conference management and meetings (notably subprogrammes 2 and 4 at duty stations).

Directs the Department to provide and coordinate meeting and documentation services for all intergovernmental organs and expert bodies at Headquarters and other locations (shared responsibility with Directors‑General at Geneva, Vienna, Nairobi) — directly reflected in the PPB’s integrated global conference‑servicing model and in subprogrammes 2–4 across duty stations.

Mandates the Department to provide technical and substantive secretariat services to the Committee on Conferences — implemented via the planning/coordination activities described in the PPB (subprogramme 2 and references to Committee on Conferences support).

Obliges the Department to provide advice to the Secretary‑General and Secretariat departments on matters relating to the bodies it services — aligns with PPB references to advisory/ procedural support functions (subprogramme 1 and executive direction).
Directs the Department to provide advice to presiding officers of UN bodies — reflected in the PPB’s description of procedural and substantive support (Subprogramme 1).

Mandates provision of protocol services to the Secretary‑General, Deputy Secretary‑General and visiting high‑level dignitaries, and host‑country liaison and, upon request, to the President of the General Assembly — implemented in the PPB under Executive direction and management and the Protocol and Liaison Service (sections on protocol services).

Mandates the Department to provide secretariat services to the International Annual Meeting on Language Arrangements, Documentation and Publications — mirrored in the PPB (paragraphs noting the Department chairs/serves as permanent Chair and provides substantive support).

Directs the Department to manage conference‑servicing resources at Headquarters and provide policy guidance on utilization of apportioned resources under Directors‑General at other duty stations — reflected in the PPB’s integrated global management approach and programme support (Global Innovation and Data Analytics Service, Executive Office).

Requires the Department to formulate budget proposals collaboratively with conference operations at Geneva, Vienna and Nairobi and present an integrated conference management budget to intergovernmental bodies — corresponds to PPB budgeting and programme support functions described throughout Part B (resource requirements and tables).

States that the Department is headed by the Under‑Secretary‑General and that senior officials perform functions set out in ST/SGB/2015/3 as well as the bulletin — establishes managerial responsibilities reflected in PPB governance and executive direction sections.

Assigns responsibility to the Under‑Secretary‑General for all Department activities and administration and for representing the Secretary‑General in related meetings — connects to PPB descriptions of executive direction and management (paragraphs 2.201–2.205 and related).

Gives the Under‑Secretary‑General responsibility to guide integrated global conference management, establish policies and standards and allocate conference‑servicing resources for optimal delivery — directly implemented in the PPB (sections on integrated global management, delegation of authority, and programme support/Global Innovation and Data Analytics Service).

Assigns the Under‑Secretary‑General the role of chairing the International Annual Meeting on Language Arrangements, Documentation and Publications — reflected in the PPB (noting the Department’s role as permanent Chair and coordination of multilingualism).

Identifies the Assistant Secretary‑General’s accountability to the Under‑Secretary‑General and that the post has specific functions — corresponds to PPB references to senior management roles in executive direction and integrated global conference management.

Mandates the Assistant Secretary‑General to assist the Under‑Secretary‑General (including assuming operational and policy‑setting responsibilities) — maps to PPB operational leadership duties and management of Headquarters activities.
Directs the Assistant Secretary‑General to act as Officer‑in‑Charge in the Under‑Secretary‑General’s absence — a managerial mandate implemented in departmental governance as described in the PPB.

Designates the Assistant Secretary‑General as focal point for integrated global conference management and additional reporting officer for heads of conference operations in Geneva, Vienna and Nairobi — reflected in PPB integrated governance and coordination across duty stations.
States that the Office of the Under‑Secretary‑General is headed by a Chief accountable to the Under‑Secretary‑General — defines internal management structure supporting PPB executive functions.

Mandates the Office to support the Under‑Secretary‑General and Assistant Secretary‑General in discharging their responsibilities — directly connects to executive support activities described in the PPB (Executive Office functions, coordination).

Directs the Office to provide overall coordination in preparation and revision of departmental inputs to the programme budget — implemented in the PPB (Part B budget tables and the Office’s budget coordination role).

Mandates the Office to provide support to the Under‑Secretary‑General in his role as Secretariat‑wide Coordinator for Multilingualism — reflected in the PPB (paragraphs on multilingualism coordination and Office of the Coordinator for Multilingualism).

Requires the Office to provide substantive and technical secretariat services to the International Annual Meeting on Language Arrangements, Documentation and Publications and the annual coordination meeting of conference managers — aligns with PPB references to those meetings and the Department’s coordination role.
Directs the Office to coordinate internal and external communication of the Department — corresponds to PPB references to coordination and stakeholder engagement.

Establishes the Director of the General Assembly and Economic and Social Council Affairs Division and accountability to the Under‑Secretary‑General — a management mandate reflected in PPB Subprogramme 1 leadership responsibilities.

Mandates the Division to provide technical secretariat services and substantive support to the General Assembly and its committees — directly implemented in the PPB under Subprogramme 1 (detailed objectives and planned results).

Mandates the Division to provide secretariat services and substantive support to the Economic and Social Council and most of its subsidiary and ad hoc bodies — reflected in Subprogramme 1 activities in the PPB.
Mandates the Division to provide secretariat services to the Trusteeship Council — corresponds to the PPB description of servicing responsibilities.
Mandates the Division to provide secretariat services to conferences and other ad hoc meetings under UN auspices — reflected in PPB cross‑duty‑station conference management activities.
Directs the Division to plan and organize activities and services related to sessions of the organs noted above — maps to PPB operational planning functions for subprogramme 1.
Mandates assistance to Presidents of the General Assembly and other presiding officers on conduct of work — reflected in PPB advisory and procedural support roles.

Requires the Division to advise delegations and Secretariat entities and to provide analytical briefs to senior officials on major deliberations — implemented in PPB (procedural advice, analytical information under Subprogramme 1).
States that the Protocol and Liaison Service is headed by a Chief accountable to the Under‑Secretary‑General — sets management for protocol functions implemented in the PPB.

Mandates the Service to provide protocol services to the Secretary‑General and Deputy Secretary‑General during meetings and visits of high‑level dignitaries — reflected in PPB sections on protocol and liaison services.
Mandates provision of protocol services to the President of the General Assembly — implemented in the PPB (Protocol and Liaison Service responsibilities).

Directs the Service to provide host country liaison services, registration of diplomatic personnel and processing of diplomatic privileges and immunities — corresponds to PPB Protocol Service deliverables.

Mandates accreditation services for delegates and participants (HQ and other locations the Department services), issuing badges/passes, ensuring compliance with protocol practice — directly implemented in PPB (paragraphs on accreditation and registration in Protocol and Liaison Service).

Requires the Service to provide briefings to newly arrived permanent representatives and organize presentation of credentials and periodic briefings on protocol practices — reflected in PPB Protocol Service functions.

Directs maintenance of up‑to‑date lists of Heads of State/Government and ministers, the diplomatic personnel database (Blue Book), and issuing official lists of delegations — implemented by Protocol and Liaison Service as described in the PPB.

Mandates organizing official ceremonies, luncheons, dinners, social events and photo opportunities hosted by the Secretary‑General or spouse at Headquarters — aligns with PPB Protocol Service event management tasks.
Directs assistance to permanent missions/observer missions with preparations for official visits of high‑level persons — implemented in PPB Protocol and Liaison Service activities.

Establishes the Central Planning and Coordination Division headed by a Director accountable to the Under‑Secretary‑General — sets leadership for functions implemented in the PPB (planning/coordinating).

Mandates the Division to develop and coordinate the biennial calendar of conferences and meetings worldwide and to schedule all meetings at Headquarters — directly corresponds to PPB planning and calendar functions (subprogramme 2 and Central Planning activities).
Directs coordination of the daily programme of meetings at Headquarters and at other locations for New York‑headquartered bodies — implemented in PPB (scheduling and meeting management tasks).

Mandates the Division to plan and monitor documentation processing schedules at Headquarters and coordinate with other duty stations to ensure workload sharing and compliance with timeliness and documentation control mandates — directly reflected in PPB (documentation and workload‑sharing measures across subprogramme 3 and planning).
Requires coordination of servicing meetings at locations away from established headquarters, as appropriate — implemented in PPB (conference management for meetings away from HQ).

Directs preparation of statistical and analytical reports on conference management activities at Headquarters and collaboration with other duty stations to ensure compatibility of statistical reports — corresponds to PPB reporting and performance indicators (see subprogramme 2 deliverables and performance measures).
Mandates providing technical and substantive secretariat services to the Committee on Conferences — reflected in PPB support to that Committee (references across subprogrammes).
Directs the Division to prepare and process the Journal of the United Nations — implemented in the PPB (references to Journal of the United Nations in Geneva and other duty stations).
Establishes the Documentation Division headed by a Director accountable to the Under‑Secretary‑General — management basis for documentation functions in the PPB.

Mandates translating all official UN documents, meeting records, publications and correspondence into and from the six official languages at Headquarters and other duty stations — core mandate implemented throughout PPB Subprogramme 3 (Documentation services).
Mandates translating selected materials into German — aligns with PPB references to the trust fund for German language translation and documentation activities.
Directs issuing summary records of meetings entitled to them in the working languages of the bodies concerned — implemented in PPB documentation deliverables and performance measures.

Requires editing drafts of parliamentary documents and preparing official records of meetings and sessions — corresponds to PPB functions of Subprogramme 3 (editing, desktop publishing, quality management).
Mandates issuing drafting and editorial guidelines for the Secretariat — reflected in PPB emphasis on quality assurance, translation quality management framework and terminology standards.

Directs maintaining the United Nations Terminology Database and providing on‑demand reference/terminology services to language professionals and reporters — directly implemented via UNTERM and referenced throughout the PPB (subprogramme 3 deliverables).

Mandates preparing and proofreading parliamentary documents and other materials for printing and electronic dissemination using text‑processing and desktop publishing — core activity in PPB Subprogramme 3 and subprogramme 4 publishing deliverables.

Directs processing and dispatching correspondence from the Secretary‑General, Presidents of main organs and Secretariat departments — an operational documentation mandate reflected in the PPB’s services and workflows.
Establishes the Meetings and Publishing Division headed by a Director accountable to the Under‑Secretary‑General — management basis for meetings and publishing functions in the PPB.

Mandates providing interpretation services in the six official languages for meetings at Headquarters and, per policy, at other locations the Department services — core mandate implemented across PPB Subprogramme 4 (Meetings and publishing services) and duty‑station descriptions.

Directs provision of meeting room services at all meetings at Headquarters and at other locations for New York‑headquartered bodies — implemented in PPB (meeting support, room logistics described in subprogramme 4).

Mandates preparing and processing verbatim records of meetings of the General Assembly, Security Council and other entitled bodies — reflected in PPB performance measures and planned results on verbatim records (subprogramme 4).

Requires developing and applying standards for typographic formatting of UN documents and providing guidance on electronic publishing best practices — implemented in PPB publishing strategy and investments in digital platforms and gDoc/gText projects.

Directs preparing and proofreading publications and other materials for printing and electronic dissemination using text‑processing and desktop publishing — aligns with PPB publishing and desktop publishing reforms (subprogramme 4 and coordination with subprogramme 3).

Mandates printing and distributing parliamentary documents, mandated publications and other materials in hard copy and/or electronic form through the Official Document System and other tools (including subscriber dissemination) — directly implemented in PPB deliverables (publishing operations, eSubscription, on‑demand printing).
